input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: THE HOUSE OF MEN. Summary: Public Works Contract with Purchase Order - Interior Finishing Including Stripping, Plastering, Coating of Walls and Ceilings, Painting and Floor Coverings. Description: The purpose of this contract is to appoint a contractor who will be responsible for carrying out interior finishing work, including stripping, plastering, coating walls and ceilings, painting and floor coverings within the building. certain accommodation belonging to LA MAISON DES HOMMES, as and when required. The various purchase orders will therefore target interior finishing work in an inhabited/occupied or uninhabited/empty home. The quantities which will be ordered are not precisely known when the contract is awarded. Indeed, at the time of writing the conditions of this contract, LA MAISON DES HOMMES is not able to precisely define the accommodations which will be concerned and the amount of work it will need. Consequently, the different items are planned in presumed quantities (QP). Minimum order quantities are not guaranteed. The presumed quantities indicated in the special specifications governing the this market are given for purely indicative purposes, they do not bind LA MAISON DES HOMMES in any way. Therefore, the successful bidder does not have an acquired right to produce certain quantities and he will not be able to claim any compensation in the event that the quantities presumed would not be affected. Category (CPV code): Floor and wall covering work (45430000). Published Date: 2025-11-08. Closing Date: 2025-12-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: NAMUR. Summary: Outsourcing of Part of Drain Cleaning and Mechanical Sweeping (Stock Market 2026-2027). Description: Outsourcing of part of the drain cleaning (stock market 2026-2027). This mission includes transport (preliminary operations included), carrying out the cleaning and all costs linked to the execution of the contract (labor, water, prices linked to vehicles, etc.) with the exception of sludge treatment and, occasionally, the mission includes street sweeping during periods of high service activity. The market was established following the bad weather in July 2021 in order to guarantee more cleaning important drains to limit the risks associated with blocked drains. The requested interventions are centralized outside the city center, the streets to be treated are communicated by the Public Cleanliness department when ordering. The successful bidder is required to ensure access to structures allowing the cleaning of drains. Category (CPV code): Gully cleaning services (90641000). Published Date: 2025-11-08. Closing Date: 2025-12-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Outsourcing of Part of Drain Cleaning and Mechanical Sweeping (Stock Market 2026-2027)
output.Description: Outsourcing of part of the drain cleaning (stock market 2026-2027). This mission includes transport (preliminary operations included), carrying out the cleaning and all costs linked to the execution of the contract (labor, water, prices linked to vehicles, etc.) with the exception of sludge treatment and, occasionally, the mission includes street sweeping during periods of high service activity. The market was established following the bad weather in July 2021 in order to guarantee more cleaning important drains to limit the risks associated with blocked drains. The requested interventions are centralized outside the city center, the streets to be treated are communicated by the Public Cleanliness department when ordering. The successful bidder is required to ensure access to structures allowing the cleaning of drains. Category (CPV code): Gully cleaning services (90641000)

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITY OF LIEGE. Summary: Construction and Renovation of 101 Student Accommodations on the Gembloux Agro-Bio Tech Campus. Description: This works contract concerns the construction and renovation of 101 student accommodations on the Gembloux Agro-Bio Tech campus of ULiege as part of the Wallonia recovery plan sub-program 243 aimed at the creation of public interest housing specifically for students.<br> The operation involves, in two phases to ensure the continuity of the provision of student housing on campus, (1) the demolition of building G028 and the reconstruction of a new building with 50 student housing units, (2) the renovation of the building existing G029, already hosting student accommodation and its reconfiguration to adapt it to current technical and comfort standards and (3) the renovation of the surroundings.<br> The project must meet strict requirements in terms of environmental and energy performance, particularly through the use of biosourced and reused materials, or the management of rainwater around buildings; as prescribed in the technical specifications.<br> The project should enable ULiege to provide its students with student accommodation on the Gembloux Agro-Bio Tech campus. up to standards, at affordable prices, according to the price scales of the Center for Studies in Sustainable Housing (CEHD). The housing and their common areas are designed in strict compliance with the conditions imposed by the recovery plan and translated into the technical submission file. The whole .... input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT, INLO - DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR INFRASTRUCTURE AND LOGISTICS. Summary: Ao 06D20/2025/M035 Usufruit of Real Estate Spaces for the European Parliament in Brussels. Description: AO 06D20/2025/M035-USUFRUIT OF REAL ESTATE "WAREHOUSE" SPACES FOR THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT IN BRUSSELS<br> This opinion is intended to inform players in the real estate market as well as any other interested party on the forecast needs of the European Parliament in Brussels by 2026, in application of its real estate policy, and to collect the names of operators likely to be interested in the real estate prospecting procedure.<br> The European Parliament may then collect one or more negotiated procedures without prior publication of a contract notice, in accordance with with the provisions of point 11.1.g of Annex I to Regulation (EU, Euratom) 2024/2509 of the European Parliament and of the Council of September 23, 2024.<br> During this negotiation, the pre-equipment and work to be included as part of the usufruct will be determined.<br> Description of needs:<br> In order to respond to its storage space needs, the contracting authority is looking for a logistics building to be pre-equipped to be ready for use by the European Parliament.<br> The building may be part of a real estate complex as long as the part intended for Parliament and the land concerned, are secure and technically independent.<br> The building or real estate complex on a single site is intended to house storage functions, a reception and office space and a parking area.<br> The research concerns a building or a group of buildings with function.... Published Date: 2025-11-06. Closing Date: 2025-12-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: CATHOLIC UNIVERSITY IN LEUVEN. Summary: Dentistry - Shell Building Plot. Description: This concerns a new building of approximately 10,000 m2 on the east side of the campus with 2 underground and 6 above-ground levels where Dentistry and Oral, Maxillofacial Surgery (MKA) services will be housed, including the surgical day center (CDC). The building has an appropriate design but is functionally an extension of the existing ambulatory center and will be accessed via the upper square east (east access). The building includes, among other things: consultation boxes for dentistry and MKA, CDC cabinets for MKA and THK and a radiology department. The works of the current tender, the sanitary/heating/ventilation lot and the electricity lot run together with the shell construction and completion lot. For a healthy and safe living environment To ensure efficient and timely pest control is essential. The object of this assignment is to conclude a framework agreement for the control, on demand, of various types of pests within the company's heritage. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FARYS. Summary: Carrying out Road and Sewerage Works in the Mussenstraat on the Territory of the Municipality of Destelbergen. Description: The present assignment involves carrying out road and sewerage works in the Mussenstraat on the territory of the municipality of Destelbergen. More specifically: • Construction of a separate sewerage system in Mussenstraat. The existing sewer system will will be removed, and 2 new lines will be constructed, 1x RWA and 1x DWA. • The DWA pipe will collect in a pump well that pumps the waste water to the existing, already renovated system further north in the Mussenstraat. • The RWA will are connected to the existing canals, which are being reprofiled. These will ultimately drain to the OS153a watercourse. An overflow wall with a passage will be placed in the canals so that they drain slowly to the watercourse. Category (CPV code): Construction work for pipelines, communication and power lines, for highways, roads, airfields and railways, flatwork (45230000). Published Date: 2025-11-06. Closing Date: 2025-12-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

This concerns both missing measures and an evaluation of existing measures in the light of the evolution listed above (with especially building at height). However, the study area also includes various spatial claims in addition to the buffering potential: heritage, nature, (hobby) agriculture, village facilities, recreation and soft mobility, port traffic, should be given their place where relevant. a limited surface area. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: GRIMBERGEN. Summary: Concession Collection of Textiles Via Textile Containers at Locations in the Municipality of Grimbergen. Description: The concessionaire is responsible for the collection via textile containers and the processing of household textile waste in the municipality of Grimbergen. The collection takes place via textile containers at various locations in the public domain and, if necessary, private land that is publicly accessible. Door-to-door collection is not part of this concession order. The concession holder pays a concession fee per ton of textile waste and receives in return for the services provided collection and processing of these textiles, the right to dispose of the collected textiles. The concessionaire is responsible for the collection and processing of the textiles at his own expense, including the non-reused and/or non-recycled portion. The The concession holder must also be responsible for clearing up illegal dumping next to these textile containers. The annual volume of textile waste can be estimated based on the number of inhabitants of the municipality of Grimbergen (40,000 inhabitants). According to the statistics from OVAM, approximately 10 kg of textile waste is selectively collected per citizen per year. In 2024, 384 tons of textiles were collected in the municipality of Grimbergen, which is in line with the OVAM averages. The concessionaire is responsible for: inform about the expected collection potential. Category (CPV code): Refuse recycling services (90514000). Published Date: 2025-11-06. Closing Date: 2025-11-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Concession Collection of Textiles Via Textile Containers at Locations in the Municipality of Grimbergen

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: IVAGO. Summary: Processing of Green Waste. Description: IVAGO is looking for a provider to process its green waste from selective collection for a period of three years (extendable by 1 year), starting from January 1, 2026.<br> Green waste is defined as: all compostable organic waste from gardens, parks, public areas (e.g. prunings, leaves, lawn clippings, plant remains, weeds, garden and cut flowers, hedge clippings), banks of watercourses or roadsides or from nature reserves plus, in limited quantities (approx. 5%), tree stumps, branches.<br> Processing means: the acquisition and the effective recycling through green composting in accordance with current legislation.<br> The green waste can consist of the following flows: household waste (collected door to door or at the recycling parks) and/or municipal waste (collected through maintenance work by municipal services).<br> The The provider must be responsible for the processing location with delivery bunker and/or a transshipment location at a maximum of 25 km driving distance (calculated on the basis of the shortest distance by road, one-way via Routenet with 40 T truck) from the central point (IVAGO head office, Proeftuinstraat 43, 9000 Ghent).<br> In the event of transhipment, the provider is responsible for both the transport from the transshipment location to the processor and the processing of all green waste itself.<br> For the volumes released in the municipality of Destelbergen, the provider must not only be responsible for loading and processing trans.... Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-12-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: MINISTRY OF THE GERMAN-SPEAKING COMMUNITY OF BELGIUM. Summary: Public Construction Contract: Partial Demolition of the Former Girls' School Building Located at Schulstrasse 18 in Eupen.. Description: It is a property located at Schulstraße 18 in 4700 Eupen. The building was built in the 19th century as a school for the children of the growing workforce due to the growth of industry and commerce. The existing building consists of 4 floors. Basement, ground floor, 1st floor and attic. The property lies along Schulstrasse and forms a triangle with the adjacent city park. The terrain slopes steeply towards the city park, so that the exit is in the The basement is on the parking level. The front facade as well as the original side facades and the forecourt are listed buildings. Due to the long period of vacancy, the building has suffered significant damage. This has massive water ingress The roof and the floors were badly damaged, so that some floor ceilings collapsed. Renovation using conventional methods is not appropriate due to the severe deterioration and in terms of energy efficiency. There is currently no intended purpose for this building in front. But from a static point of view and because of the poor building structure, a controlled partial demolition is necessary. The focus is on preserving the listed facade elements. The basement area will remain, as will the forecourt. In Floor plans, sections, static reports, photos and the monument permit are enclosed with the systems. Category (CPV code): Construction work (45000000). Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-12-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: Restoration of a Boardwalk in the Houtebos in Vilvoorde. Description: The assignment concerns the restoration of an old decking path, including: - the demolition and removal of the existing decking path including the plastic support posts; - repairing the decking path with new materials excluding the decking planks and the cross beams (these are recovered from the yard of another ANB project 'Hof ter Linden' and supplied by ANB); - making the existing decking path wheelchair-friendly by installing edge planks to prevent sideways driving. These work take place in the Houtembos domain in Vilvoorde, on a rather wet terrain, the use of road plates may be necessary. All materials released in this assignment become the property of the contractor, unless stated otherwise. Included in this assignment is therefore the correct disposal and processing of these materials in accordance with the applicable regulations. A prior site visit is recommended but not mandatory. A site visit can be made up to 5 days before the deadline for submitting quotations and must be requested 5 days prior to the date of the site visit from the supervisory official: Wouter Huygens (wouter.huygens@vlaanderen.be, 0474 89 78 86). For substantive information, please contact: Dirk Meersman (dirk.meersan@vlaanderen.be, 0478 28 21 61) and Jan Vrebosch (jan.vrebosch@vlaanderen.be, 0470 74 02 92). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: LIBIN. Summary: Creation of the School Path in Libin. Description: This project consists of the creation of a cycle-pedestrian path between Fosse-des-Biays and the center of Libin (Spar and medical center). This project is divided into three parts: - Part 1: the creation of a concrete track 2.5 meters wide, with the creating a safe, making fences and planting trees. This track connects Fosse-des-Biays to rue d'Hatrival. - Part 2: The creation of bicycle markings from the sports center to the medical center. It is also included the repair of pedestrian crossing markings. In this part, 185 meters of water nets are also being replaced for the safety of cyclists. - Part 3: Renovation of the sidewalk and parking lots along rue du commerce between the park (Cabin electric) and the SPAR. Category (CPV code): Construction work (45000000). Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-12-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BEP ENVIRONMENT. Summary: Construction Work on the New Circular and Social Economy Center in Rhisnes - Feder Project. Description: This contract is a contract for construction works and equipment for the new circular and social economy center in Rhisnes. This center, which is the subject of an FEDER project, will be located behind the existing site of the Ressourcerie Namuroise de Rhisnes. It will include 4 infrastructures specific:<br> - a workshop space<br> - a permanent repair shop in which citizens can come and have a series of various objects and furniture repaired<br> - a materials library intended to promote reused materials<br> - a recuparc, recyparc focused on reuse with voluntary contribution space<br> The market is divided into 2 lots:<br> - LOT 1: Main works contract and premises equipment<br> - LOT 2: Contract for development of surroundings and fences<br> Construction of the circular and social economy center of Rhisnes<br> LOT 1 includes all construction work for the future economy center circular and social of Rhisnes. It includes civil engineering works, structural work, special techniques, finishing, but also the supply of equipment intended for the operation of future installations (shelving, tools, containers, furniture, etc.). It is therefore aimed at a general contractor.<br> Development of the surroundings of the circular and social economy center of Rhisnes<br> LOT 2 includes all the work development of the surroundings and fencing of the future circular and social economy center of Rhisnes. It includes planting work and of fence.<br> Compliant.... Published Date: 2025-11-03. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: NATUURPUNT BEHEER VZW. Summary: Framework Agreement for Soil Research. Description: The main tasks of Natuurpunt Beheer vzw are the preparation of management plans and the organization, development, management and opening of nature reserves in Flanders.<br> The object of the assignment is:<br> - drawing up exploratory and descriptive sludge and soil surveys in the context of the Soil Decree, according to OVAM standard procedures<br> - drawing up technical reports on earthmoving with declaration of conformity<br> - nutrient research with report preparation<br> - updating technical report with declaration of conformity<br> - drawing up reports of sampling and analysis in order to obtain a raw material declaration<br> - supervising excavations of rubble-containing embankment layers<br> If during the term of the assignment the Soil Decree, the Vlarebo and/or the standard procedures are changed, the order holder must take the changes into account. The different ones partial assignments are carried out at various locations in Flanders. For each partial assignment, the tenderer must follow up the soil investigation in all aspects: technical, financial, environmental hygiene and administrative. The following minimum performances are expected from the service provider:<br> -advice<br> -supervision and control<br> -sampling and have analyzes carried out<br> -general research follow-up<br> -financial investigation follow-up<br> - formatting reports<br> - supervising and monitoring projects with rubble-containing embankment layers<br> -extend reports/declarations of conformity if they have expired<br> It concerns an agreement .... Tender Value: 165288.00. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-11-03. Closing Date: 2025-11-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The following minimum performances are expected from the service provider:<br> -advice<br> -supervision and control<br> -sampling and have analyzes carried out<br> -general research follow-up<br> -financial investigation follow-up<br> - formatting reports<br> - supervising and monitoring projects with rubble-containing embankment layers<br> -extend reports/declarations of conformity if they have expired<br> It concerns an agreement ...

Description: IVBO wishes to replace all duct burners on the 3 combustion lines (line A-B-C). This year (2025) this must happen in one line. The replacement on the other lines will be carried out in the following years (2026 and 2027). In these specifications, a price is requested for the implementation on 1 incineration line, namely line B in 2025. After that, IVBO can have 2 more repeat orders carried out on the other lines. Assignment content: • The supply, installation, connection, testing and commissioning of the 2 channel burners in the sleeve filter installation of one combustion line, at the same location as the current duct burners of that line, • All necessary supplies and works to put those 2 duct burners into service with a blank Vlarem II inspection report (Report of the Commissioning Examination), • All necessary safety measures to work safely with natural gas.<br> Category (CPV code): Construction work (45000000). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: SCIENTIFIC INSTITUTE OF PUBLIC SERVICE. Summary: Service Contract for the Purpose of Tests Aimed at Controlling the Conformity/In-Service Verification of Vehicles According to Isc and Isv Procedures. Description: The object of the contract is the provision of services relating to the performance of tests aimed at controlling the conformity/in-service verification of vehicles according to ISC and ISV procedures. Description of the services to be performed: the bidder undertakes to carry out tests on vehicles which will be selected and delivered by the Walloon authority (SPW). These tests consist of verifying conformity in ISC service and also verification in ISV service on certain families. The engines to be tested will mainly be thermal (ICE) and non-rechargeable hybrids. (NOVC-HEV). The bidder must have the equipment required to carry out a conformity check, WLTP Type 1 tests, RDE tests and PEMS validations, Type 6 tests, coastdown (ISV) or even artificial strategies (ISV). The tests must be carried out according to the standard ISO/IEC 17025. The bidder will attach to his offer, the certificate of his accreditation as well as his scope of accreditation. These services fall under the CPV code: 71630000-3; 71631200-2. This is a service market in a sector sensitive to fraud: NO. Lot(s): In application of the article 58 of the law of June 17, 2016, allotment should be considered. The contract is not divided into lots for the following reasons: the contracting authority decides not to allocate the contract due to the management of vehicle logistics and the possible presence of an ISSeP agent in .... Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-11-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: LINT. Summary: Commercial Core Strengthening: Reconstruction of Church Square and King Albert Street. Description: The assignment concerns the strengthening of the commercial center in Lint near Kerkplein and Koning Albertstraat. The perpendicular car parks in Koning Albertstraat will become safer longitudinal car parks, Koning Albertstraat will become a cycling zone, some of the car parks on Kerkplein will be paved and greened and another part can be reserved for itinerant trade. The bus stop in Statiestraat 'Koning Albertstraat' will become a new accessible bus stop with bicycle shed. The former public toilet behind Koning Albertstraat 2 will be demolished and the slow road from Kerkplein to the Torfsstraat is being upgraded. Rainwater from part of the roof of the church is collected in a rainwater well for reuse by municipal services. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH LAND COMPANY. Summary: Ni Berlare Broek - Donkmeer: ​​Part C Nature Development Works Berlare Broek. Description: The nature development works to be carried out are located within 2 sub-areas on the territory of the municipality of Berlare. Most of the work will be carried out in the Berlare Broek sub-area, while in Maeydonk the work to be carried out is sooner are limited. Both sub-areas are characterized by a high groundwater table and high water levels in the watercourses and ponds. These very wet terrain conditions ensure that earthworks can only be carried out in the driest conditions carried out. In addition, the ban on working during the spawning and breeding season also applies. So tight planning and flexibility is necessary given the short suitable period for implementation. The work to be carried out concerns: - Felling and harvesting of trees and shrubs - Demolishing existing structures (old footbridges, old weirs, old street furniture, etc. - Creating swamp zones (puddle - marsh) for reed development at two locations by excavating and partially filling a pond with a closed soil balance - The local realization of new paving (small surfaces of concrete paving, concrete tiles (Sigma style), grass tiles and porphyry paving) - The construction of a new top layer of porphyry crushed stone on existing hiking trails. - Installing hydraulic infrastructure, hardwood sheet piling, fish-passable adjustable stainless steel weir 2 m, two prefab adjustable gate valves, ... - Installing recreational infrastructure.... Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-11-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Ni Berlare Broek - Donkmeer: ​​Part C Nature Development Works Berlare Broek
output.Description: The nature development works to be carried out are located within 2 sub-areas on the territory of the municipality of Berlare. Most of the work will be carried out in the Berlare Broek sub-area, while in Maeydonk the work to be carried out is sooner are limited. Both sub-areas are characterized by a high groundwater table and high water levels in the watercourses and ponds. These very wet terrain conditions ensure that earthworks can only be carried out in the driest conditions carried out. In addition, the ban on working during the spawning and breeding season also applies. So tight planning and flexibility is necessary given the short suitable period for implementation. The work to be carried out concerns: - Felling and harvesting of trees and shrubs - Demolishing existing structures (old footbridges, old weirs, old street furniture, etc. - Creating swamp zones (puddle - marsh) for reed development at two locations by excavating and partially filling a pond with a closed soil balance - The local realization of new paving (small surfaces of concrete paving, concrete tiles (Sigma style), grass tiles and porphyry paving) - The construction of a new top layer of porphyry crushed stone on existing hiking trails. - Installing hydraulic infrastructure, hardwood sheet piling, fish-passable adjustable stainless steel weir 2 m, two prefab adjustable gate valves, ... - Installing recreational infrastructure...

Conversion of an Industrial Site into a Center of Socio-Cultural Activities as Part of the Cqd Compas in Anderlecht - Works Contract - Open Procedure. Description: The contract concerns the reconversion of an industrial site into a socio-cultural activity center as part of the “Compas” sustainable neighborhood contract. This involves redeveloping, via renovation and partial demolition-reconstruction operations, the part northwest of the former Desmedt printing works. The municipality of Anderlecht is the owner of the site and will operate a local infrastructure housing various municipal services and associations currently scattered throughout the municipality. The site includes a section of the future Sennette park. As part of this request, only the demolition of the existing building on this section is planned. The development of the park itself will be carried out by Bruxelles Environnement within the framework of the Urban Renovation Contract (CRU) 5. This works contract includes: - the demolition of buildings and annexes located on the route of the future Sennette park and between the main existing buildings preserved; - securing the house located on rue de Liverpool, called “building A”; - the renovation and transformation of industrial buildings kept inside the block into a facility of collective interest composed of: o a R+1 building on plot B150M32, including an underground car park, hereinafter referred to as “building B”; o a R+2 building on plot B150L31, called “building C”; o a volume which connects buildings B and C, called “building D”. Summary: Service Contract for the Renovation and Insulation of Facades and Roofs, on an Occupied Site, of a Social Housing Building Comprising a Total of 32 Housing Units and Offices. Description: Complete study and work monitoring mission for the renovation and insulation of the facades and roof, on an occupied site, of a social housing building comprising a total of 32 housing units and offices, located Avenue Constant Permeke 83 in 1140 Evere. For this mission of project author, the contracting authority wishes to appoint a multidisciplinary team composed of an architect, a stability engineer, a special techniques engineer, a PEB advisor and a safety coordinator health. The contracting authority wishes to have a direct contractual link with the architect, the stability engineer, the special techniques engineer, the PEB advisor and the health and safety coordinator. In the event that specific personnel necessary to carry out all of the planned missions is not found within the same professional structure, a team of participants is formed into a group of economic operators. The one who will represent the group with regard to the contracting authority, and who will be responsible for coordinating the studies and services carried out by the other members of the group is the architect. Applications do not guarantee the project owner from the selection phase to benefit from this direct contractual link will be rejected. Summary: Awv/Inv/2025/1 Mobilidata Ivri Supply, Installation, Maintenance and Adjustment of Intelligent Traffic Controllers in Flanders Part its Application and Ris 4. Under delivery This means providing services to make the ITS application and RIS work functionally, whereby both applications are purchased according to the Software as a Service principle. Second phase: This phase is repetitive and leads to: A request for a simulation based on a model of the client. The results of the simulation can be included in the selections for subsequent mini-competitions. or A mini-competition that leads to the awarding of an agreement per mini-competition to a maximum of one contractor. These contract documents of the framework agreement are next case attached AWV/INV/2025/1_IR006AWV Lot 1: 20 intersections in Flanders Lot 2: 15 intersections in Flanders Lot 3: 10 intersections in Flanders The tenderers for the framework agreement are free to submit a quote or not for the plots of this case.<br> AWV/INV/2025/1 - 1<br> Doc Title: AWV/INV/2025/1 Mobilidata iVRI Supply, installation, maintenance and adjustment of intelligent traffic controllers in Flanders part ITS application and RIS 4<br> Contract Type: services. The works for buildings 3 and 4 will start in summer 2026 and must not disrupt the operation of the campus, paying particular attention to safety, heritage conservation and sustainability. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: CITYDEV. Summary: Work Process Including the Design, Execution and Operation of a Material Yard (Design, Build & Operate). Description: The objective of the project is to renovate, develop and equip the Vanderperren site, located rue Nestor Martin 42 in Ganshoren, on the Darwin plot, in order to make it a logistics hub dedicated to the reuse of construction materials in the Brussels-Capital Region. This strategic infrastructure will aim to support existing sectors, while accelerating the development of the reuse sector on a more structured, more robust and more impactful scale for the Region. The project will primarily target large-scale projects carried out by large private developers and project owners. public in Brussels, where the potential for recovery and reuse of materials is particularly important. Part of a participatory and integrative approach, the project aims to mobilize all public and private stakeholders concerned, relying on open governance and collaborative. The infrastructure thus developed should benefit the entire reuse ecosystem, by facilitating synergies, structuring logistics flows and contributing to a local and resilient circular economy.<br> WORK PROCESS INCLUDING DESIGN, EXECUTION AND OPERATING A MATERIAL YARD (DESIGN, BUILD & OPERATE)<br> The objective of the project is to renovate, develop and equip the Vanderperren site, located rue Nestor Martin 42 in Ganshoren, on the Darwin plot, in order to make it a logistics hub dedicated to the reuse of construction materials. in.... This assignment consists of 3 lots: • Design & realization • Furnishing • Operation The implementation design and coordination of the realization will start immediately after the award. The aim of this assignment is to furnish the new building in a timely manner within the set framework in order to achieve the desired result in a timely manner. The facility itself will be included in a 2nd plot. The The contractor offers solutions based on designs and style guides of building blocks to achieve a total design. This is in accordance with the described functionalities and materialization. The products that will actually be ordered will also be delivered and set up ready for use. From this framework contract can be purchased during the entire term for the realization of (re)designs in the new building or at other VRT locations. In the context of further exploitation, this framework contract also includes asset management, design and maintenance. Preference to work with 1 party. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: IVAGO. Summary: Collection and Processing of Discarded Mattresses. Description: The project aims to replace the split-type air conditioning systems currently installed in computer rooms, in order to increase the available cooling power. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITY OF ANTWERP. Summary: Building D.U-C Lot Hvac. Description: The assignment concerns the renovation of building section D.U-C on Campus Drie Eiken of the University of Antwerp. This building houses three research groups that work with animal experiments and will remain in use during the works. Careful planning and phasing is essential to prevent research activities to disrupt. The HVAC lot includes the partial dismantling of the existing installations and the installation of new ventilation, heating and cooling installations. Modifying an existing ventilation system and expanding a new ventilation system are also part of the assignment. The contractor of lot HVAC works closely with the secondary contractors of Electricity, Construction and Lab Furniture. Nuisance caused by noise, vibrations and dust must be kept to a minimum. Music or noisy behavior on the site is prohibited. The provisions of the safety and health plan (Eveka bvba) and the smoking ban on campus are strictly applicable.<br> Category (CPV code): Heating, ventilation and air-conditioning installation work (45331000). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND LANDSCAPE STUDIES. Summary: Public Market for Earthwork and Creation of Landscaping Along the Historical Center Canal between Elevators 1 and 4. Description: This contract consists of the creation and support of landscaping, i.e. a green framework aimed at preserving the aesthetic and environmental framework around it and adapting the infrastructure of the SPW-MI to climate change. The project will also make it possible to achieve the fellings necessary to secure the site while avoiding individual permit requests. Over the past thirty years, the annual felling of trees necessary to secure the UNESCO World Heritage site has never been compensated by any replanting (even during the storm of the year 2000 which severely hit the Elevator loop 3). The present work includes preparation of the land, planting and support with a 5-year recovery guarantee, for 394 trees in size 16/18. The selected species were chosen based on their abilities to withstand climate change and are renowned for their resistance to disease. Trees are also selected for their contribution to biodiversity. The size of these trees as adults is modeled on the existing canopy, their autumn coloring respecting also the known character of this walk.<br> Category (CPV code): Landscaping work for roads and motorways (45112730). Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-11-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND LANDSCAPE STUDIES

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: INACEP. Summary: Focant Lesse Cycle Link. Description: This contract includes the execution of the following works: The roads are classified in network II and III. These specifications describe the creation of a cycle-pedestrian path between the village of Focant and the Ravel L150 in Wanlin, on the edge of the Lesse, some 4.5km of journey. This project was initiated jointly by the Beauraings and Houyet. Each municipality has designated Inasep as the author of the Project. It is planned to implement a concrete covering 2.50m wide, on all sections on their own site. Three small sluices on ditches as well as a large sluice on the Auge stream, a non-navigable watercourse, falling under provincial jurisdiction. A prior agreement with the SPT will be reached to determine the best period of work (low water, wildlife, etc.). At rue de Focant, in the town of Beauraing, a wooden footbridge will be put in place to pass a wetland. On arrival at Wanlin, it is planned to install directional signs only, with occasionally guidance by chevrons on the ground, in order to guide users towards the Ravel de la Lesse. The land will not be evacuated. These will be reused to create a privacy barrier in Beauraing, and the land will be brought together into one mound in Houyet. In order to reduce the impact on flora and fauna, the addition of exogenous soil is prohibited. The work will be subject to restricted periods which will be specified by the DNF. He is not.... Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: PORT OF ANTWERP-BRUGES NV UNDER PUBLIC LAW. Summary: (Monitoring And) Enforcement of Emission Standards of (Freight) Cars in the Port of Antwerp through Remote Sensing. Description: The aim of the project is to set up sensors with which the emissions of passing vehicles can be measured from a short distance. This with a view to: 1) (through the Monitoring section): the inventory of the current emission situation (in particular: fleet composition and extent of exceedance of Euro standards) of the current (truck) fleet in and around the port of Antwerp; 2) (through the Enforcement section): initiating a renewal and renewal of the (truck) fleet, prior to the expected increase in traffic due to the realization of Extra Container Capacity in the port of Antwerp. In the context of this assignment, emission results must be obtained from at least 200,000 singly and validly measured emissions. of vehicles, spread over at least 4 strategically chosen measuring sites in and around the Antwerp port area, within a period of at least 25 and a maximum of 50 calendar days. The contractor may assume that the measuring locations will be located on highways and important traffic axes in and around the port area with a traffic dynamic whereby engine loads can be expected in a very significant part of the passing vehicles, necessary to improve the emission performance can assess. The campaign focuses on measuring sites with significant traffic volumes, where an average of at least 4,000 vehicles per installation will probably drive by per 24 hours.... Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The WEST wing is reconfigured into laboratories and the NORTH wing into offices.<br> -For the SOUTH wing: replacement of the frames and repair of the roof, technical compliance.<br> -The renovation of the surrounding areas (building bases and large square courtyard, underground parking).<br> In order to guarantee the continuity of certain activities, the following phasing is announced: work in the wing WEST which will be completely emptied before the start of the project (the NORTH and SOUTH wings remain occupied and in activity during this phase), transfer of the laboratories to the renovated WEST wing and emptying of the NORTH wing by ULiege, work in the NORTH wing. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: CITY OF AALST. Summary: Theme Space. Public Works Department. Framework Agreement for Construction, Maintenance and Repair Works of Canals, Watercourses and Buffer Infrastructure in Aalst. Description: This assignment is part of the management of canals and waterways (asset management). In part to ensure that good drainage is guaranteed or, conversely, the water is retained so that it can infiltrate better and be drained off less quickly.<br> Our waterways form an important habitat (flora) and migration corridor (fauna) that usually have important functions related to the different areas in which they are located (residential, nature, agriculture, industry). In order to be able to (or continue to) fulfill these functions, they must be maximally open and designed ecologically.<br> Today they are therefore considered to be the so-called green-blue ribbons.<br> This assignment includes, among other things, for canals, watercourses, buffer basins, etc.:<br> • Clearing sludge;<br> •Maintenance of banks and greenery present on them;<br> • Renewal of arches (referred to as 'culverts');<br> •Construction of watercourses and basins<br> •Construction of plot entrances (usually at the expense of the applicant - arrangement for working at the request of third parties);<br> •Opening up watercourses by removing pipes and tubes from those watercourses;<br> • Designing watercourses (instead of buffering and infiltration, strengthening the ecology);<br> •Installing bank reinforcement;<br> •….<br> Theme Room. Public Works Department. Framework agreement for construction, maintenance and repair works of canals, watercourses and buffer infrastructure in Aalst<br> In part to ensure good drainage insure.... Tender Value: 4600000.00. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Theme Space. Public Works Department. Framework Agreement for Construction, Maintenance and Repair Works of Canals, Watercourses and Buffer Infrastructure in Aalst

In order to be able to (or continue to) fulfill these functions, they must be maximally open and designed ecologically.<br> Today they are therefore considered to be the so-called green-blue ribbons.<br> This assignment includes, among other things, for canals, watercourses, buffer basins, etc.:<br> • Clearing sludge;<br> •Maintenance of banks and greenery present on them;<br> • Renewal of arches (referred to as 'culverts');<br> •Construction of watercourses and basins<br> •Construction of plot entrances (usually at the expense of the applicant - arrangement for working at the request of third parties);<br> •Opening up watercourses by removing pipes and tubes from those watercourses;<br> • Designing watercourses (instead of buffering and infiltration, strengthening the ecology);<br> •Installing bank reinforcement;<br> •….<br> Theme Room. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: Exotic Species Control on the East Coast Dunes. Description: Through this assignment, the contracting authority wishes to restore the European protected dune habitats along the Belgian east coast in the context of the DUNIAS project. In dune areas owned and/or managed by ANB and partners, the designated plant invasive exotic species must be removed/treated to become. Ruffle roses (Rosa Rugosa), Mahogany (Mahonia aquifolium) and other non-native shrubs must be carefully and systematically ringed, pulled out, sieved out or chemically controlled. During implementation, special attention must be paid to limiting regrowth from root parts maximum removal of all plant parts. With a view to efficient control, practical tests have been carried out at home and abroad and the board has determined a 'best practice' based on this assignment. These methods are further explained in these technical provisions. Place of performance: Heist; Bredene; De Haan. 6 plots. • Plot 1: Sashul (Heist) • Plot 2: Duneroze, Duinbossen De Haan and Spanjaardduin • Plot 3: Zeepreventorium • Plot 4: Sloping slopes De Haan and Wenduine & Wrakhoutbrug • Plot 5: Prins Albertpark • Plot 6: Parks to the south van Koninklijke baan CPV-code: De opdracht omvat hoofdzakelijk activiteiten met het kenmerk van werken • 45112500-0 grondverzet • 45112200-7 afgraven van grond • 45112400-9 graafwerkzaamheden. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: Executing and Analyzing a Proof-Of-Concept for the Agro-Management Plan Concept. Description: The aim of the assignment is to test the concept of the agricultural management plan through a proof-of-concept approach. By drawing up "conceptual" management plans for a number of agricultural companies according to the approach of a nature management plan, i.e. with the various steps of the current approach, but then applied to an agricultural company and adapted to agricultural nature and agricultural management. This is plot 1 and plot 2. In the third plot, the "conceptual" agricultural management plans are analyzed in terms of design and purpose and the formulation of policy recommendations. This order is an order for services within the meaning of art. 2, 21 of the Public Procurement Act of 17 June 2016.<br> Category (CPV code): Environmental planning (90712000). instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: VISITFLANDERS. Summary: Towards the Use of Pumped Groundwater on the Vilain Xiiii Estate in Leut: Design and Studies. Description: The object of the assignment is a study into the possibilities of using pumped groundwater for various purposes on the Vilain XIIII estate in Leut. Tourism Flanders owns the estate, which is located in a mining subsidence area. About the consequences of the mine subsidence To combat this, millions of m3 of groundwater are pumped away into the Meuse every year. The drainage pipes of that pumped groundwater run through the castle park. Toerisme Vlaanderen wants to investigate whether it is possible to use part of that pumped water, initially to protect the area. rewetting, but other possible applications should also be investigated. The contractor maps out the needs analysis in consultation with the main stakeholders and, together with the client, prepares additional studies and research and provides guidance throughout the process. The study assignment leads to a preliminary design and design and ends with specifications for the preparation of the implementation files. The project proposal is part of the new PIO call from VLAIO. https://www.vlaio.be/nl/nieuws/ontdek-de-nieuwe-pio-projecten-0<br> Category (CPV code): Architectural, construction, engineering and inspection services (71000000). Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-11-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Towards the Use of Pumped Groundwater on the Vilain Xiiii Estate in Leut: Design and Studies

Tourism Flanders owns the estate, which is located in a mining subsidence area. About the consequences of the mine subsidence To combat this, millions of m3 of groundwater are pumped away into the Meuse every year. The drainage pipes of that pumped groundwater run through the castle park. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AUTONOMOUS MUNICIPAL COMPANY TIENEN. Summary: Municipal Swimming Pool De Blyckaert - Renovation of the Roofs. Description: In June 2002, the De Blyckaert swimming pool opened its doors. The roof, dating from that time, shows signs of wear, causing rain and melt water to seep in at various places in the building, including the public area. The roofs need to be completely renovated to continue to ensure the comfort of visitors and employees. The opportunity is also used to provide proper insulation so that energy costs can be kept under control. The prospective tenderer is obliged to make a site visit to assess the situation to be verified on site. The coordinates of the contact person to record this site visit can be found in the administrative section of the special specifications.<br> Category (CPV code): Roof works and other special trade construction works (45260000). Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-12-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: Conservation Works Hobos. Description: The Flemish government - Nature and Forests Agency, together with the municipality of Pelt, owns an 18th century farm with outbuildings located in Pelt - Het Hobos 1. The farm is protected as a cultural-historical landscape. Conservation works on this farm are necessary to safeguard the building from further damage until the actual restoration work takes place. The estate has remained virtually unchanged over the past century and consists of a varied landscape of forests, meadows, orchards, ponds, wooded edges and an old building complex with a vegetable garden and park elements. Colored by the fascinating history of some striking former residents, the site is a household name in Pelt and the surrounding area. Since 2000, the Hobos has been registered as a protected cultural-historical landscape. The Hobos farm has been declared architectural heritage since 2018. Years of neglect and vacancy However, this has led to the buildings on the site being in serious disrepair. Major works are therefore necessary to maintain the buildings and subsequently open up the site within the 'Hoge Kempen' National Park. The Agency for Nature and Forests is looking for a contractor who can do the following work execute. The shipyard is located in Pelt, Het Hobos 1. The shipyard is located in the Cultural-historical protected landscape: Hobos. - Decree no. 4.03/72029/101.1 - Protection of 18/04/2000 The contract includes: All kinds of maintenance works (stability, disassembly, repair masonry, etc.) to Hob.... Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-11-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: IN BW ASSOCIATION INTERCOMMUNALE. Summary: Treatment of Plaster Waste from Recycling Parks in Bw. Description: The purpose of the envisaged contract is the treatment of plaster waste from in BW recycling centers for a period of 1 year, renewable once for one year. This market, concerning the 17 recycling parks in BW, presents two lots. Lot 1 includes the 10 parks in Eastern Walloon Brabant and lot 2, the 7 Western parks. By treatment, we mean any waste recovery process in accordance with the legislation in force in the Walloon Region. The market is divided into lots as follows: Lot 1 "recyparcs of Jodoigne, Orp-Jauche, Incourt, Perwez, Rixensart, Wavre, Chaumont-Gistoux, Court-St-Etienne, Villers-la-Ville and Walhain" and Lot 2 "recyparcs of Genappe, Nivelles, Braine-le-Chateau, Ittre, Rebecq, Braine-le-Comte and Tubize" The allocation will be made on the basis of the corrected price as stipulated in the CCh.<br> Category (CPV code): Refuse and waste related services (90500000). Description: The purpose of this contract is the construction of the Neufvilles wastewater treatment plant on the territory of the municipality of Soignies. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AQUAFIN NV - PROJECT MANAGEMENT DIRECTORATE. Summary: V1251003 - Dendermonde/Appels, Renovation of Ps Zandstraat. Description: V1251003 - Dendermonde/Appels, renovation of PS Zandstraat. Zandstraat pumping station in Appels is a 2+0 setup with dry-installed pumps. The pumping station needs to be mechanically and electrically renovated. The setup will be a 1+1 setup, with the electrical cabinet closer to the pump well will be placed. The works are on public land, on the village square of Appels. The pumping station needs to be thoroughly renovated, which involves the following works: - Temporary measures + signaling - Anchor inspections of existing valve. - Installing and connecting dry installations pumps - Supply, install and connect level measurements (probe + radar) - Completely renew ALSB and move it to the right - Replace existing dry pumps (pumps supplied by aquafin) - Supply and install new bilge pump in dry basement - Renew pipework + drainage options incl. securely fasten - Supply and install new valves and non-return valves - Install drive-over covers - Supply and install new ladders<br> Category (CPV code): Sewage plant equipment (45252130). Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-12-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The pumping station needs to be mechanically and electrically renovated. The setup will be a 1+1 setup, with the electrical cabinet closer to the pump well will be placed. The works are on public land, on the village square of Appels. The pumping station needs to be thoroughly renovated, which involves the following works: - Temporary measures + signaling - Anchor inspections of existing valve. - Installing and connecting dry installations pumps - Supply, install and connect level measurements (probe + radar) - Completely renew ALSB and move it to the right - Replace existing dry pumps (pumps supplied by aquafin) - Supply and install new bilge pump in dry basement - Renew pipework + drainage options incl. securely fasten - Supply and install new valves and non-return valves - Install drive-over covers - Supply and install new ladders<br> Category (CPV code): Sewage plant equipment (45252130)

Summary: Services for Various Hydrological Restoration Projects in the Kleine Nete Basin between Herentals and Ten Aard in the Context of Pas Nitrogen Remediation and Realization of Ihd (2 Plots). Description: The Agency for Nature and Forests wishes to conclude a framework agreement in two lots with external contractors to purchase various services for groundwater research (lot 1), further planning and design of measures (lot 2) for various water projects in the river basin. Kleine Nete between the weir in the Spaans hof in Herentals and the weir on the Kleine Nete in Kasterlee near Houtum. Following ecohydrological research into wetland and marsh restoration in De Zegge Mosselgoren and Olens Broek (Witteveen+Bos, 2024), large-scale changes have been made to the hydrological system is necessary to achieve the European nature goals. To ensure all this runs smoothly, a Taskforce for De Zegge was set up within the area coalition of the Kleine Nete. The task of this Task Force is to implement the ecohydrological measures study further and implement it in the field. The Taskforce consists of the Flemish environmental administrations Agency for Nature and Forest (ANB), Institute for Nature and Forest Research (INBO), Flemish Environment Agency (VMM), Flemish Land Agency (VLM) and Department of Environment, the provincial service for integrated water policy and the Office of the Governor of the province of Antwerp. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: MIROM ROESELARE. Summary: Processing Hard Plastics. Description: This assignment includes the processing of hard plastics (Eural code: 20.01.39) that originate from households and similar industrial waste flows that are selectively supplied by the residents of the Mirom Roeselare operating area at the recycling parks of the 12 affiliated municipalities.<br> In addition Mirom Roeselare offers the residents of its operating area the service of offering large household waste at home for collection.<br> The various waste materials are collected in containers and transported to the processors by Mirom Roeselare or the transporters designated by the board.<br> As an environmental care company Mirom Roeselare wants to keep the number of kilometers driven limited. By dividing the order into small plots, Mirom Roeselare hopes to reach smaller and more local market players. This order has been divided into 100 lots, each containing a volume of 10 tons of hard plastics. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: GERMAN-SPEAKING COMMUNITY LESSONS. Summary: Award of a Public Service Contract for a Framework Contract for the Cleaning of Rooms and Windows in Various School Buildings. Description: Since our current structure and human resources will not be sufficient to cover all tasks, integrating an external service provider is a logical next step. This approach allows us to flexibly access additional capacity and specialized knowledge when required without overloading our internal team. External support for basic cleaning: One of the biggest challenges for our staff is the annual basic cleaning during the summer holidays, when the majority of the staff is on vacation. Our staff is in accordance with the work regulations are obliged to take the main holiday during school holidays, which means that we only have 50% of staff available during the summer holidays. In addition, unforeseen factors such as illness, special leave or additional use of the building during the holidays further bottlenecks. In order to ensure the annual basic cleaning of the schools and to meet the expectations of the building users, an external service provider is commissioned to take on these tasks during the month of July-August. This relieves our team considerably and provides... ensure that the buildings are in perfect condition when the new school year begins. Additional services on request: The external partner can also be called in for other specialized tasks, including: • Sealing the floors: Regular sealing is required notw.... Published Date: 2025-10-27. Closing Date: 2025-12-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: CITYDEV. Summary: Work Process Including the Design, Execution and Operation of a Material Yard (Design, Build & Operate). Description: The objective of the project is to renovate, develop and equip the Vanderperren site, located rue Nestor Martin 42 in Ganshoren, on the Darwin plot, in order to make it a logistics hub dedicated to the reuse of construction materials in the Brussels-Capital Region. This strategic infrastructure will aim to support existing sectors, while accelerating the development of the reuse sector on a more structured, more robust and more impactful scale for the Region. The project will primarily target large-scale projects carried out by large private developers and project owners. public in Brussels, where the potential for recovery and reuse of materials is particularly important. Part of a participatory and integrative approach, the project aims to mobilize all public and private stakeholders concerned, relying on open governance and collaborative. The infrastructure thus developed should benefit the entire reuse ecosystem, by facilitating synergies, structuring logistics flows and contributing to a local and resilient circular economy.<br> WORK PROCESS INCLUDING DESIGN, EXECUTION AND OPERATING A MATERIAL YARD (DESIGN, BUILD & OPERATE)<br> The objective of the project is to renovate, develop and equip the Vanderperren site, located rue Nestor Martin 42 in Ganshoren, on the Darwin plot, in order to make it a logistics hub dedicated to the reuse of construction materials. in.... input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BORNEM. Summary: Expansion of the Ventilation System of the Kloosterheide Hall. Description: Hall Kloosterheide is a very busy room located within the walls of the abbey. This room can be rented by associations but also by private individuals. During the various school holidays, this room is used by the youth service for organizing the playground activities. This room, built in 2011, has a ventilation unit, but its flow rate is too limited. This assignment consists of installing a ventilation unit with heat wheel and heat pump on a site to be provided platform on the outside of the building. Category (CPV code): Heating, ventilation and air-conditioning installation work (45331000). Published Date: 2025-10-26. Closing Date: 2025-11-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: ANTWERP. Summary: Framework Agreement for Taking Samples of Pipe Insulation Suspected of Asbestos. Description: The City of Antwerp is expanding its existing services for the source collection of asbestos cement applications with a temporary and additional project that focuses on the removal of asbestos-containing pipe insulation by private individuals. This impulse project will be fully subsidized by OVAM and offers a unique opportunity to provide additional support to families in the safe removal of asbestos-containing pipe insulation. This project is only intended for private individuals. Self-employed people, schools, associations, etc. cannot claim these subsidies. This assignment is part of the process for the removal of asbestos-containing pipe insulation and consists of: • taking samples of pipe insulation suspected of asbestos from private individuals. The asbestos expert will at the request of the contracting authority, to carry out samples of suspected asbestos-containing pipe insulation from private individuals. • carrying out random checks of asbestos removal sites carried out in accordance with the above mentioned inventory. Category (CPV code): Asbestos removal services (90650000). Published Date: 2025-10-26. Closing Date: 2025-11-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITY OF ANTWERP. Summary: Renovation of Building Section D.U-C. Description: The assignment concerns the renovation of building section D.U-C on Campus Drie Eiken of the University of Antwerp. The building houses three research groups with animal experiments and will remain in use during the works. Careful planning and phasing is necessary so as not to disrupt research activities. The Construction and Finishing lot (lot 30) includes the demolition of interior walls, ceilings, floors and interior joinery, followed by new architectural layouts, epoxy floors, mineral fiber ceilings, interior doors and painting. Radiation-resistant and hygienic finishes (cleanroom requirements) are also part of the assignment. The contractor of lot 30 acts as the coordinating contractor for the site layout and must work closely with the secondary contractors of HVAC, electricity and lab furniture. Nuisance caused by noise, vibrations and dust must be kept to a minimum; music or noisy behavior is prohibited. The provisions of the safety and health plan (Eveka bvba) and the smoking ban on campus are strictly applicable. Category (CPV code): Construction work (45000000). Published Date: 2025-10-26. Closing Date: 2025-11-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Renovation of Building Section D.U-C

The building houses three research groups with animal experiments and will remain in use during the works. Careful planning and phasing is necessary so as not to disrupt research activities. The Construction and Finishing lot (lot 30) includes the demolition of interior walls, ceilings, floors and interior joinery, followed by new architectural layouts, epoxy floors, mineral fiber ceilings, interior doors and painting. Radiation-resistant and hygienic finishes (cleanroom requirements) are also part of the assignment. The contractor of lot 30 acts as the coordinating contractor for the site layout and must work closely with the secondary contractors of HVAC, electricity and lab furniture. Nuisance caused by noise, vibrations and dust must be kept to a minimum; music or noisy behavior is prohibited. The provisions of the safety and health plan (Eveka bvba) and the smoking ban on campus are strictly applicable. Category (CPV code): Construction work (45000000)

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH ENVIRONMENT AGENCY. Summary: Preparation, Analysis and Reporting of Pfas in Particulate Matter and Deposition Near Hotspots. Description: This assignment consists of preparing, analyzing and reporting PFAS on filters (suspended dust) and in jars (deposition) that will be sampled between January 2026 and January 2028. It is estimated that 70 analyzes on dust filters and 260 analyzes on deposition samples must be carried out in accordance with WAC/IV/A/025. An estimated 397 analyzes will also have to be carried out on deposition samples in accordance with WAC/IV/A/026. This difference in number of analyzes between the procedures is an additional one have a safety margin. Category (CPV code): Services related to air pollution (90731000). Published Date: 2025-10-26. Closing Date: 2025-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: CHARLEROI WATERWAYS DEPARTMENT. Summary: Ronquières Inclined Plane - Revision of the Drain Valves of Tank 1. Description: The purpose of this contract is to repair the 2 drain valves of a tank and their dismantling joint as well as the supply of a new dismantling joint. The SPW has a reserve drain valve. In order to limit the duration of on-site interventions, the dismantling of each valve and dismantling joint will be followed directly by the reassembly of a revised valve with a revised dismantling joint and a new actuator. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: Various Furnishing Works in Zammelsbroek. Description: Within this framework, several nature development works are provided for in the Zammelsbroek nature reserve, in Geel. These works are part of the Sigma plan, within which flood areas are being designed. The Zammelsbroek consists of an extensive area flood zone around the Grote Nete. Several large-scale nature development projects are currently underway, with a view to the development of biodiverse habitats including swamps, wet grasslands and swamp forests. With the planned furnishing works, ANB wishes to prepare reedlands under development for future regular mowing management, to design a pond complex ecologically, to facilitate management by designing a site road, exotic species management and the construction of recreational infrastructure. Category (CPV code): Construction work (45000000). Published Date: 2025-10-25. Closing Date: 2025-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The works include: - Preparatory construction and demolition works of existing road surfaces, footpaths, local and linear elements and existing sewerage; - Earthworks necessary for the execution of the works as indicated on the longitudinal and cross profiles; - Construction of a DWA sewerage system; - Making house and street gully connections; - Construction of roadway in bituminous hardening; - Construction of a traffic plateau at the intersection of Gentsestraat-Vlaanderenstraat-Withuisstraat; - Construction of footpaths in concrete paving stones and natural tiles; - Construction of parking lanes in grass concrete tiles; - Installation of guide tiles for the blind; - Placing ter cast-on-site edge strips and prefabricated curbs in concrete and imitation blue stone; - Installing street furniture (anti-parking posts, waste bins, bicycle racks, etc.) - Construction of green areas and tree areas. Category (CPV code): Road construction works (45233120). Published Date: 2025-10-25. Closing Date: 2025-11-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: DG AIR TRANSPORT. Summary: Special Specifications Relating to Services for the Appointment of an Expert in Information Security and Cybersecurity (Part-Is) for Dg Transport Aviation. Description: The Directorate General Air Transport (DGTA) is responsible for overseeing the aviation sector in Belgium with the aim of ensuring the safety, security and sustainability of aviation. Given the increasing digitalization and growing threat cyberattacks in the aviation sector, it is essential that the DGTA has specialist expertise in information security and cybersecurity. This contract concerns the appointment of an information security expert and in Cybersecurity, who will play a key role in supporting management-s oversight missions. The expert will make the link between technical knowledge in information security and cybersecurity and the operational reality of the aviation supervision, and will contribute to strengthening the resilience of the Belgian aviation sector in the face of information security and cyber threats. The information security and cybersecurity expert must be based on the requirements set out in Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/1645, in Implementing Regulation (EU) 2023/203 and in the sections of PART-IS relating to EASA AMC and GM. In addition, the information security and cybersecurity expert must know the obligations arising from the NIS2 law. For the analysis of events and incidents in the aviation sector, please refer to Regulation (EU) No 376/2014. Category (CPV code): Hazard protection and control cons.... Published Date: 2025-10-25. Closing Date: 2025-11-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Special Specifications Relating to Services for the Appointment of an Expert in Information Security and Cybersecurity (Part-Is) for Dg Transport Aviation

This contract concerns the appointment of an information security expert and in Cybersecurity, who will play a key role in supporting management-s oversight missions. The expert will make the link between technical knowledge in information security and cybersecurity and the operational reality of the aviation supervision, and will contribute to strengthening the resilience of the Belgian aviation sector in the face of information security and cyber threats. The information security and cybersecurity expert must be based on the requirements set out in Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/1645, in Implementing Regulation (EU) 2023/203 and in the sections of PART-IS relating to EASA AMC and GM. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: URBAN DEVELOPMENT GHENT. Summary: Construction and Renovation of a Total of 18 Individual Homes for Social and Budget Rent. Description: This procedure aims at the appointment of a construction team, in this case a multidisciplinary team, with the task of constructing and renovating a total of 18 individual homes for social and budget rent. The 18 homes are spread over 4 locations. Modest retains reserves the right not to have the renovation of the two non-connecting houses (house numbers 269 and 273) carried out at the Kasteellaan location (see below). These two homes are each included as a conditional part of this assignment, which means: Modest can decide individually whether or not to implement each of these homes. In summary: The permanent part of this assignment includes: * the renovation of 5 homes located at Kasteellaan 257, 259, 261, 263 and 265 in 9000 Ghent; * the renovation of 8 homes located in area Abrikoosstraat 43, 47, 49, 59, 63, 65, 67, 69 in 9000 Ghent and the associated 8 storage rooms; * the demolition and reconstruction of 2 homes located at Langestraat 134 and 138 in 9050 Ledeberg; * the realization of a new-build home on the vacant plot located at Ledebergstraat 60-64 in 9050 Ledeberg. The conditional part 1 of this assignment includes: the renovation of the house Kasteellaan 269. The conditional part 2 of this assignment includes: the renovation of the house Kasteellaan 273. This publication was commissioned by Modest, daughter of urban development company Sogent. Category (CPV code): Construction work (45000000). Published Date: 2025-10-25. Closing Date: 2025-12-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: SCHAERBEEK. Summary: School 13 - Kindergarten Extension Project. Description: Purpose of the contract Works contract aimed at extending the nursery school at the Linthout complex. Location of work School 13 - Athénée Fernand Blum - Roodebeek section - Avenue de Roodebeek 107 to 109 to 1030 Brussels Important note The project is registered in the ‘Linthout- school complex. The project aims to build an extension to school 13 in order to accommodate the kindergarten classes which are currently located inside the school complex. This extension will be built on two plots, one unbuilt and the other including an investment building to be demolished. This building to be demolished is located at n°109 avenue de Roodebeek. The new building will consist of a ground +4 volume with a level of cellars. It will include two reception classes, a room nap time, nursery classes, a room for teachers and parents, as well as technical rooms and toilets associated with these functions. The new building is adjacent to the school which is classified and which is the work of the architect Henri Jacobs. A passage is planned between the new construction and an existing class of the classified volume on the 1st floor. Part of the listed enclosure wall will have to be demolished, and a bay will have to be drilled into the said wall. The forecourt, also classified, is redevelop using partly existing materials. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FPS PUBLIC HEALTH FOOD CHAIN SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENT. Summary: Development of the Entrance to the Building Located at 5 Avenue Galilée as Part of the Biodiversiscape. Description: This contract concerns the redevelopment of exterior spaces at the Galilée building located avenue Galilée, 5 in 1210 Saint-Josse-ten-Noode. The spaces to be redeveloped include those present in avenue Galilée, rue du Pôle and rue Brialmont from the facade to the boundary border with the sidewalk. The redevelopment of these areas aims in particular: • The installation of plantations and devices favorable to biodiversity without compromising accessibility and current and future uses; • The realization of a natural pond, the creation of a pedestrian access covering with storage arches for bicycles, the installation of plantations favorable to biodiversity, the installation of a network of support cables for the greening of facades, without compromise accessibility and current and future uses. The contracting authority chooses the negotiated procedure with prior publication. The market does not include lots. This is a global price market (R.R. April 18, 2017, art. 2, 3°). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: PROVINCE OF ANTWERP - DEPARTMENT OF LOGISTICS - INFRASTRUCTURE SERVICE. Summary: Mol - Zilvermeer Provincial Domain - Concrete Renovation Beach Building. Description: The assignment includes: • dismantling the steel awnings that were attached to the concrete awnings; • repairing the concrete of the canopies; • applying a protective coating afterwards; • replacing the joints between the precast concrete edge elements; • reassembling the steel awnings. A preliminary investigation was carried out to determine the condition of the concrete. This preliminary investigation has been added in the appendix. The columns and beams and the concrete slabs above 1st floors have an acceptable concrete cover and are minimally affected. These can be repaired by locally removing the loose and damaged concrete and repairing it with hydraulic repair mortar. Near the concrete slabs of the awning above on the ground floor, the estimate of the percentage of loose and damaged concrete is 30% to 70% of the surface area. Here, 2 mandatory variants are provided, namely local repairs such as columns and beams or the global removal of the concrete cover by hydrodemolition, followed by the application of shotcrete. The final choice will be determined after detailed probing of 2 bays so that the percentage of affected concrete can be estimated significantly more correctly. After repair, it will be fully equipped a carbonation-inhibiting coating, the joints of the precast concrete edges will be renewed and the steel canopies will need to be repaired. Category (CPV code): Concrete repair work (45262330). Published Date: 2025-10-25. Closing Date: 2025-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: PROVINCE OF ANTWERP - DEPARTMENT OF LOGISTICS - INFRASTRUCTURE SERVICE
output.Summary: Mol - Zilvermeer Provincial Domain - Concrete Renovation Beach Building

A preliminary investigation was carried out to determine the condition of the concrete. This preliminary investigation has been added in the appendix. After repair, it will be fully equipped a carbonation-inhibiting coating, the joints of the precast concrete edges will be renewed and the steel canopies will need to be repaired. Category (CPV code): Concrete repair work (45262330)
