input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HERENT. Summary: Measuring and Digitizing the Quality of Roads and Cycle Paths in Herent. Description: Object of this assignment: Lot 1: Measuring and digitizing the road surface quality on the territory of the merged municipality of Herent. This assignment includes: • Measuring the roadway (x, y and z) with great accuracy; • Digitization of the measuring and creating a height map of the road surface; • Standardize the data, for example using the “International roughness index”; • Creating georeferenced HD images; • Making the above data compatible for Geoportal. Explanation: The municipality of Herent is looking for an alternative way to determine the road surface quality of Herent's roads. We want to map the profile of the road based on a detailed measurement, with high resolution mapping, digitizing and visualizing in order to map the deviations as accurately as possible. This gives us as a municipality the opportunity to analyze the various streets via our own GIS application and to display them directly to map overall quality and/or comfort. By planning maintenance in a targeted manner based on objective data, efficiency and safety for the citizen improves. These specifications provide for carrying out 180 km of road surface measurement in Herent. The quantities in the inventory (VH) are an estimate of the measurements to be carried out for the above-mentioned streets. Under no circumstances can the service provider obtain any form of compensation if the anticipated number.... Published Date: 2025-10-25. Closing Date: 2025-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: THE HOMES OF THE POOR SISTERS ASBL. Summary: Appointment of a Multidisciplinary Team for the Renovation and Extension of the Mons Rest Home. Description: The Rest House of the Poor Sisters of Mons accommodates 115 residents, divided into 3 services. All of the current buildings house rooms and premises for community life and services provided to residents. Besides the 2 service residences, the Maison des Pauvres also offers a day care center welcoming 15 people. The Rest House of the Poor Sisters of Mons is made up of heterogeneous buildings of different constructions within a residential block in near the center of Mons. The buildings are composed as follows: -Building A located Rue de Bertaimont 22; -Building B located inside the block; -Building C located Rue de Bertaimont 24; -Building D located on the Place Nervienne side; - Buildings Community located inside the block; -Kitchen building located inside the island; -2 Serviced Residences located at Place Nervienne 10 and 11; -A chapel and its cloister located in the heart of the built complex; -A large wooded park. The current buildings only partially meet the standards in force. The project involves the demolition of buildings B, Community and Kitchen as well as the rehabilitation of building A. Building D being the most recent, it will be subject to a slight renovation and adaptation. structural allowing its integration into the new project. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AREA DEVELOPMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING AND PROJECTS. Summary: Integrated Development Vision through Design Research with an Action Program for Climate-Adaptive Design of Moelingen. Description: Drawing up an integrated climate-robust development vision through, among other things, design research, resulting in an action program for the redevelopment of Moelingen. The passage of the Berwijn is one of the key projects defined in the VMM's Berwijn Master Plan. Er On the one hand, the project will focus on individual protection of existing homes and a number of location-specific interventions, but through this assignment work will also be done on a longer-term vision for a climate-robust design of Moelingen. Attention is paid to the desired level of protection (safety risk), the reconstruction of public and private space, but also to promote flooding dynamics in the surrounding open space. The Berwijn banks are being radically redesigned based on the history of the floods (see appendix). This development has an influence on the living environment of all residents. The current lack of an integrated climate-robust development vision, within which internal and external initiatives are framed and weighed against each other, results in a loss of quality for the future image of the village - both in municipal policy, as well as with residents and initiators. In order to form a more qualitative, future-oriented whole, an integrated climate-robust development vision is drawn up through design research with an action program via this service assignment.<br> Category (CPV .... Published Date: 2025-10-24. Closing Date: 2025-11-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: AREA DEVELOPMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING AND PROJECTS

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: VRIJE UNIVERSITEIT BRUSSEL (3P). Summary: Replacing Air Groups - Hvac. Description: Object of these works: Replacing collectors - HVAC. The existing collectors date from construction in the early 1980s. Since the then concept, various adjustments and renovations have been made to the building, for example replacing the glass with glass with a u-value of 1.1. . The technical components that are responsible for the distribution and control of the heating in the building have also reached the end of their lifespan. The initial design regimes assumed high temperatures (more than 70C), these temperatures allow a phased transition to a fossil-free generation via heat pumps is very difficult and also means that the installation is no longer tailored to current needs. The issues mentioned above make the renovation of the main collectors in order to enable low temperatures, together with adequate control for heat distribution, indispensable. The file includes the preparation of implementation plans and technical sheets, the preparation of the necessary technical calculations and the commissioning of the approved materials and the installation as a whole. Place of execution: Vrije Universiteit Brussel, Laarbeeklaan 103, 1090 JETTE This assignment concerns the renewal of the collector heating in Jette - building D - level 1.<br> Category (CPV code): Heating, ventilation and air-conditioning installation work (45331000). Published Date: 2025-10-24. Closing Date: 2025-12-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Replacing Air Groups - Hvac

The perimeter of this assignment is owned by the City of Brussels and falls under the coordination of the Land Management Agency of the City of Brussels. Description: This framework agreement concerns the development of new Lottery Shops and the relocation or renovation of existing Lottery Shops in commercial premises rented by the National Lottery or owned by it. This refers to the work/arrangement of the premises from A to Z for the implementation implementation of a store concept developed by the National Lottery, on the basis of a clear plan and measurement established by an architect. This includes, without limitation, the removal of old equipment from commercial premises, ceiling work, painting, electricity and cabling, including installation of chosen new lighting, custom furniture, sanitary ware, heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC), etc. The work to be carried out may vary from one Lottery Shop to another and will be described in the mini-competitions in the form of a plan and a measurement drawn up by an architect. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: UC LEUVEN-LIMBURG. Summary: Cleaning Maintenance on all Ucll Campuses. Description: UCLL University of Applied Sciences offers 20 graduate courses, 22 professional bachelor courses and 9 advanced bachelor courses and 50 postgraduate courses on 8 campuses in Limburg and Flemish Brabant. With 18,000 students and 1,800 employees, UCLL is one of the largest higher education institutions in Flanders. UCLL is active in the areas of teacher training, management, technology, health and welfare and combines its educational mission with practice-oriented research and services. The university places maximum emphasis on personal guidance for its students. Description: In addition to the renovation work taking place on 14 homes in Reukens (including bathrooms, kitchens, electricity, solar panels, attic floor insulation, heating installation and ventilation systems), this assignment includes the renewal of the exterior carpentry. The purpose of this additional The assignment is to increase living comfort, improve energy efficiency and further optimize the sustainability of the homes. The interior reveals are completely finished in their original condition (plastering, corner profiles, skirting boards, etc.). The concrete implementation of the works is, however, inextricably linked to the moment at which the homes in question are actually available. As a contracting authority, we cannot currently predict with certainty when these homes will become available, nor whether all 14 homes will be effectively addressed. within the term of this assignment. The implementation will always be planned and coordinated in close consultation with the awarded contractor, as soon as a home becomes available or when residents give permission to carry out the work during occupancy. The timing and practical organization of the works will therefore differ per home. This working method requires a high degree of flexibility and good cooperation between the contracting authority and the contractor. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: CITY OF LIEGE - WORKS - PUBLIC SPACE MANAGEMENT DEPARTMENT. Summary: Framework Agreement for the Coordination of Safety and Health on Temporary or Mobile Construction Sites on the Territory of the City of Liege and in Particular of the Works Department of Construction Management.... Description: Framework agreement for the coordination of safety and health on temporary or mobile construction sites on the territory of the City of Liege and in particular the Department of Works and Public Space Management<br> On the one hand, the purpose of this contract is the provision of services consisting of the carrying out the missions of a safety and health coordinator during: - the development of the study of the work (project coordination); - its execution (coordination-execution). In the spirit of the Royal Decree of January 25, 2001 relating to temporary or mobile construction sites, this is of a major and essential aspect in the execution of work in public spaces since the coordination of safety and health concerns the safety of all authorized or unauthorized people having access to the site: local residents, passers-by, etc. Furthermore, this contract is a framework agreement of services: - concluded for a fixed period of one year, starting on January 1, 2026 at the earliest; - concluded with a single participant (article 43 §3 of the Law of June 17, 2016). When it expires, the contract may be renewed three times, for a period of 12 months each time it is renewed. The renewal is tacit. In the event that the contract is not extended, the successful bidder cannot claim damages as a result of this decision. The contract is SINGLE and INDIVISIBLE and will therefore be awarded to a single successful service provider.<br> Category (CPV code): Health and safety services (71317200). Published Date: 2025-10-22. Closing Date: 2025-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: COMINES-WARNETON. Summary: Comines-Warneton Youth and Culture Center. Renovation and Restructuring of the Cultural Center and the Public Reading Center. Description: The renovation consists of upgrading the equipment in terms of functionality, energy performance, accessibility, fire safety and acoustic performance. The main interventions of the project are as follows: - The complete replacement of the glass facades and opaque parts. - Renovation, repairs and treatment of exterior concrete. - The removal of additions subsequent to the original construction dating from 1977 on the ground floor (in terracotta brick masonry). - The reconfiguration of the monumental staircase providing access to the foyer (subject to demolition of the current staircase). - The interior restructuring of the spaces on the ground floor, the foyer, the theater, the multipurpose rooms and the public reading center. - The creation of a ventilation system. - Renovation and installation of elevators and goods lifts. - There renovation of sanitary facilities and heating system. - Renovation of the electrical installation and compliance with fire safety standards. - Renovation of stage techniques (scenography). - The redevelopment of part of the parking lot and surrounding areas, and the creation of an infiltration valley.<br> 008/GA/MW/2025 - 1<br> LOT 1: (pilot company) Structural work, completion and surroundings<br> The company includes demolitions, asbestos removal, structural work, work to perpetuate exterior concrete, roofing work, surrounding areas, buried sewers including cisterns, install it.... Published Date: 2025-10-22. Closing Date: 2025-10-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: Establishments in the Context of Blue Deal in Grootbroek Dijlevallei. Description: The purpose of this assignment is to realize ecohydrological restoration measures within the pond complex in the nature reserve 'Grootbroek' of the Agency for Nature and Forests (ANB), located in the municipality of Sint-Agatha-Rode, in the province Flemish Brabant. These recovery measures are financed by the Flemish government with Blue Deal resources. This assignment concerns the Dijle valley, which plays an important role upstream of Leuven in water management, in particular protecting the city ​​of Leuven against flooding and achieving ecological objectives in watercourse and valley. The planned measures are mainly aimed at achieving the ecological objectives (restoration of open swamp landscape from ponds) of the area. The assignment contains both a basic assignment (fixed part) and a conditional part. The conditional part comes into effect if the proposed soil codes in items 33, 34 and 35 are concluded as 991 soil code according to additional analyzes during implementation (see further in these specifications). For a more detailed description of the design measures, please refer to the technical regulations and implementation plans as added to these specifications. Category (CPV code): Excavating and earthmoving work (45112000). Published Date: 2025-10-22. Closing Date: 2025-11-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The work is carried out on roads belonging to networks IIb and IIIa. The work described above is not exhaustive, the details of the work are included in the integrated technical clauses and the summary measurement annexed to the notebook. spécial des charges. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AQUAFIN NV - PROJECT MANAGEMENT DIRECTORATE. Summary: A0199009 - Beveren, Optimization of Sludge Recirculation Pumping Station and Gates. Description: A0199009 - Beveren, optimization of sludge recirculation pumping station and gates. The aim of this project is to optimize the sludge recirculation pumping station of the Beveren WWTP, whereby the augers will be placed in a 3+0 arrangement and controlled by a sludge blanket meter. The following items must be carried out: - Supply and installation of baffle plates with manual valves in the sludge recirculation pit - Delivery and installation of platforms + handrail + stairs + ladders to reach and remove manual valves between augers descend to each auger in the sludge recirculation pit. - Delivery, installation and connection of new drive to 3 control valves of the secondary settling tanks. - Supply and installation of the spindle valve mechanism on NBT 3. - Electrical connection sludge blanket meters on every NBT - Connecting data transfer module to ALSB - Delivery file and inspection ALSB Category (CPV code): Sewage plant equipment (45252130). Published Date: 2025-10-22. Closing Date: 2025-11-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The purpose of the framework agreement: This contract has aimed at meeting the needs of first-level physical infrastructure for telematics installations of in BW services, all for a maximum of €230,000 excluding VAT. Almost the majority of buildings concerned by this contract are located in the geographical perimeter of Walloon Brabant and Hainaut (see appendix no. 2 - Our territory | in BW Corporate). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: SCHOOL GROUP 14 MAASLAND. Summary: Replaced Asbestos Corrugated Sheets. Description: The project involves the removal and replacement of the existing asbestos-containing corrugated sheets on the sloping roofs of buildings G02 and G04 of the Springplank School. G04 concerns the front building of the main building. The roofs consist of two staggered roof surfaces. The new roof covering will consist of insulated roof panels, suitable for the sloping roof structure, guaranteeing both insulation and safety standards. In addition, the project also includes tackling the smaller flat roofs adjacent to the sloping roofs. This ensures the safe removal of existing materials and a correct finish with suitable roofing. Project activities: Safe removal of asbestos-containing corrugated sheets in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. Preparation of the roof construction to correctly install the new insulated roof panels. Installation of new insulated roof panels, tailored to the staggered roof surfaces and existing roof structure. Approach to the smaller ones flat roofs, including removal of existing materials and installation of suitable roofing. Finishing and checking, including waterproofing, aesthetic integration and compliance with building regulations. Category (CPV code): Roof framing work (45261100). Published Date: 2025-10-19. Closing Date: 2025-10-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AREA DEVELOPMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING AND PROJECTS. Summary: Evaluation and Integrated Design of Buffer Areas Zeebrugge Seaport Area. Accompanying Research into the Partial Revision of the Zeebrugge Regional Rup Seaport Area. Description: The Poort Zeebrugge partnership wants to map any buffering gap in the study area. This concerns both missing measures and an evaluation of existing measures in the light of the evolution listed above (with especially building at height). However, the study area also includes various spatial claims in addition to the buffering potential: heritage, nature, (hobby) agriculture, village facilities, recreation and soft mobility, port traffic, should be given their place where relevant. a limited surface area. In addition to the analysis and evaluation of the buffering, the study area must therefore be refined into a concrete integrated design of project areas, within which spatial win-wins are sought without the effective bufferfunctie te hypothekeren. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: STRATEGIC DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT. Summary: Framework Agreement Works Contract Aimed at the Maintenance of Certain Regional Properties Located in the Provinces of Hainaut, Walloon Brabant and Namur. Description: The Walloon Heritage Agency wishes to award, for a period of 1 year renewable 3 times, a framework agreement type works contract, in accordance with articles 2, 35° and 43 of the law of June 17, 2016, (open procedure) whose purpose is to carry out periodic inspection visits and maintenance, upkeep and/or emergency interventions, if necessary, with a view to preserving the roofs of several regional properties whose management is entrusted to it. The market concerns properties regional offices located in the provinces of Hainaut, Namur and Walloon Brabant. In view of the nature of the services to be carried out (periodic inspections and conservation interventions), the quantity surveying positions are divided into 2 different sections: • COMPONENT A: concerns all annual periodic visits and routine maintenance operations to be carried out on each property; • COMPONENT B: concerns a series of items relating to common interventions that can be carried out within the framework of measures conservatories, maintenance and/or emergencies to ensure the proper preservation of property. This is in no case work which would require administrative procedures specific to the restoration of classified properties. The Adjudicator not being in able to plan now the maintenance or emergency interventions which would prove necessary to carry out to ensure the good conservation of the various assets (part B), it was decided to pass this .... input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: ASBL NOTRE DAME INSTITUTE. Summary: Eslsh Design/Building/Maintenance Centralized Boiler Room Pellets with Heating Network Version 3. Description: * Study and complete design of a heating network and a centralized boiler room operating exclusively on wood pellets (pellets) to supply the buildings of the Ecole Libre de Saint-Hubert. * Construction, construction, commissioning and validation of the entire installation; * Maintenance with upkeep and monitoring over a long period of 10 years of the entire installation. The heat network will supply 4 new heat exchange substations to replace the current oil-fired boiler rooms and the substation of the new boarding school. The centralized wood-fired boiler room will necessarily be located in the current boiler room of building B2 (Champagnat 1). The choice of the project owner is to have 2 boilers wood installed in this location. There are no plans to install or maintain a backup oil boiler in addition to these 2 boilers. Category (CPV code): Heating, ventilation and air-conditioning installation work (45331000). Published Date: 2025-10-19. Closing Date: 2025-12-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AQUAFIN NV - PROJECT MANAGEMENT DIRECTORATE. Summary: Project 23.399/1 & Wel3013 - Wellen, Connecting Sewerage Langenakker Bulsstraat. Description: Project 23.399/1 & WEL3013 - Wellen, connecting sewerage Langenakker Bulsstraat. The objective is to reduce the waste load from Bulsstraat (Alken territory) and Langenakker (Wellen territory) to the existing sewerage system in Grootstraat. (Alken territory). This is done through the construction of a separate 2DWA system with a pumping station. The roadway is mainly being redeveloped. This assignment includes in particular: • Breaking up existing sewerage; • Breaking up existing ones pavements; • Earthmoving according to current legislation (Vlarebo); • Construction of pressure pipe in HDPE; • Installation of house connections; • Installing pipes in open trench; • Construction of wadis and canals; • Construction of access wells; • Construction of pumping station and overflow construction; • Construction of new roads; • Construction of pavements in small-scale elements; • Construction of linear elements; • Construction of greenery; • Road signaling (temporary site signaling) + permanent signaling; • Archaeological research Category (CPV code): Foul-water piping construction work (45232411). Published Date: 2025-10-19. Closing Date: 2025-11-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FUND FOR INNOVATION & ENTREPRENEURSHIP. Summary: Assignment for Guidance, Support and Facilitation of a Preliminary Phase for an Innovative Government Contract for the Pio Project “Valorization of Filter Cakes of the Amoras Project”. Description: VLAIO Innovative Public Procurement Program (PIO) is looking for a service provider for guidance and support for the preparation of the innovative public procurement contract(s) for the project “Valorization of filter cakes of the AMORAS project” of Maritime Access department (aMT) of the Mobility and Public Works department and Port of Antwerp-Bruges (POAB). The AMORAS plant processes and stores the maintenance dredged material from the port of Antwerp, which is dredged to improve the port's nautical depth. and guarantee the accessibility of the port. The largest residual product from the processing of the desanded and dewatered sludge, namely the filter cakes (approx. 500,000 tons/year), is currently being dumped. The project partners useful applications and find suitable buyers for these filter cakes. Building on previous research, this assignment focuses on further substantiating the feasibility, environmental impact and CO2 footprint, and the business case of the flash calcination technology and the toepassing in cement. Category (CPV code): Engineering studies (71335000). Published Date: 2025-10-18. Closing Date: 2025-11-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Assignment for Guidance, Support and Facilitation of a Preliminary Phase for an Innovative Government Contract for the Pio Project “Valorization of Filter Cakes of the Amoras Project”
output.Description: VLAIO Innovative Public Procurement Program (PIO) is looking for a service provider for guidance and support for the preparation of the innovative public procurement contract(s) for the project “Valorization of filter cakes of the AMORAS project” of Maritime Access department (aMT) of the Mobility and Public Works department and Port of Antwerp-Bruges (POAB). The AMORAS plant processes and stores the maintenance dredged material from the port of Antwerp, which is dredged to improve the port's nautical depth. and guarantee the accessibility of the port. The largest residual product from the processing of the desanded and dewatered sludge, namely the filter cakes (approx. 500,000 tons/year), is currently being dumped. The project partners useful applications and find suitable buyers for these filter cakes. Building on previous research, this assignment focuses on further substantiating the feasibility, environmental impact and CO2 footprint, and the business case of the flash calcination technology and the toepassing in cement. Category (CPV code): Engineering studies (71335000)

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: INTERMUNICIPAL PARTNERSHIP FOR WASTE REMOVAL AND PROCESSING IN BRUGES AND THE OMMELAND. Summary: Replacing Duct Burner Sleeve Filter Line B at Ivbo in Bruges. Description: IVBO wishes to replace all duct burners on the 3 combustion lines (line A-B-C). This year (2025) this must happen in one line. The replacement on the other lines will be carried out in the following years (2026 and 2027). Price is requested in this specification for implementation on 1 incineration line, namely line B in 2025. After that, IVBO can have 2 more repeat orders carried out on the other lines. Assignment content: • Supplying, installing, connecting, testing and commissioning the 2 channel burners in the sleeve filter installation of one combustion line, at the same location as the current duct burners of that line, • All necessary supplies and works to be able to put those 2 duct burners into service with a blank Vlarem II inspection report (Report of the Examination before commissioning), • All necessary safety measures to work safely with natural gas. Category (CPV code): Construction work (45000000). Published Date: 2025-10-18. Closing Date: 2025-11-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: POM EAST FLANDERS. Summary: Renovation of the Meetjesland Business Center, Lot 3_Dakwerken. Description: The Meetjesland Entrepreneurs Center is a multifunctional business complex. The business premises are rented to start-up and young companies in expansion with temporary space needs. The business center was expanded in two phases: - Building 1: located at the front of the plot and consisting of three business units (built in 2000) - Building 2: behind building 1 and consisting of 4 business units (built in 2016) Building 1 has now been in use for 24 years. The building is structurally sound order, but visually it shows less attractive due to wear. The design of the office areas is also outdated and does not fully meet the current needs of growing companies. In addition, the building no longer meets the current requirements stricter standards, such as in the energetic field. The POM East Flanders wants to renovate the building: - to make the building visually more attractive - to spatially adapt the business units to the new needs of the companies - to to adapt the building to the new standards with regard to sustainability, energy, fire safety, ... and to make it technically sound so that it is ready to rent to start-up companies for the next 25 years without any worries. The works only relate to building 1. Robuust architecture & research bv has drawn up the design of the renovation and will monitor the implementation of the works. The works include 5 lots: 1. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR NATURE AND FOREST. Summary: The Demolition of Structures Containing or not Containing Asbestos. Description: The demolition of a number of buildings and structures in the provinces of Antwerp, Limburg and Flemish Brabant. A number of these structures contain asbestos. All materials and/or waste released during demolition as well as those lying on the plot materials and/or waste are also removed and processed in accordance with regulations. On a number of sites, the fence surrounding the plot must also be demolished and the released material must be removed. The Agency for Nature and Forests regularly purchases grounds. There are often buildings on these lands (stables, hutches, chalets and the like) and because these buildings cannot serve a function within the ANB, demolition is opted for. There are also buildings that have lost their function. These are more of a cost than a return for the agency and demolition is also opted for here. To work more efficiently and cheaper, these pillowcases, which are usually small, are bundled into one specification. These demolitions therefore represent a direct “profit” for the nature. All materials and/or waste released during demolition as well as the materials and/or waste lying on the plot are also removed and processed in accordance with the regulations. Attached to these specifications you will find a completed form for each location necessary information, asbestos inventories, demolition follow-up plans as well as the declaration of conformity for Tracimat thereof, and the safety and health plan. Category (CPV code): Demolition work (45111100). Published Date: 2025-10-17. Closing Date: 2025-11-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH ENVIRONMENT AGENCY. Summary: Research into Pfas Compounds in Groundwater - Campaign 2025. Description: The assignment is to sample and analyze groundwater in wells of the groundwater monitoring network managed by VMM. The groundwater samples are analyzed for a series of parameters: 42 PFAS compounds on approximately 457 well filters and TFA on 16 well filters. The physicochemical parameters temperature, conductivity and pH must be determined as a check on the sampling. In addition, level and depth measurements can be carried out for all well filters. The measurement campaign must be carried out during the autumn of 2025. The research is part of the monitoring of the spread of PFAS compounds and substances from the European 'Groundwater Watch List' and 'List facilitating', which will most likely soon be included as mandatory substances to be monitored in the European Groundwater Directive will be included. Category (CPV code): Analysis services (71620000). Published Date: 2025-10-17. Closing Date: 2025-10-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: ROESELARE. Summary: Construction of Archive and Heritage Depot - Plot 1: Shell Construction and Finishing. Description: The city has been looking for a sustainable solution for its city archives for some time. In addition, there has been a demand for a regional heritage depot in the Midwest region for some time. Both needs were combined and Schierveldestraat 89 became a suitable location found. The site, which is partly still in use for the reception of Ukrainian refugees, consists of a large warehouse and an office area. The current works only concern the warehouse part, which is being transformed into an archive and heritage depot. Design agency Tides from Kortrijk was awarded the design agency for these works. The outer shell of the warehouse will be replaced with energetic and fire-safe materials. The existing floor and supporting structure will be retained. The warehouse is divided into depots for documents, objects, paintings, textile and metal objects. In addition, two cold rooms, a workshop and an emergency depot are provided. There are two quarantine rooms for untreated objects at the entrance. There is no active heating or cooling provided in the depots. They are furnished according to the “Danish model”, in which a highly insulated outer shell is combined with a non-insulated floor. The mass of the floor acts as a natural temperature regulator. Only the humidity in the rooms is actively monitored. A subsidy of 500,000 euros was awarded for these works from the Flemish government's investment subsidies for cultural infrastructure. The w.... Published Date: 2025-10-17. Closing Date: 2025-11-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
